lurk.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to wait somewhere quietly and secretly, usually because you are going to do something wrong
lurk.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: She didn’t see the figure lurking behind the bushes.
lurk.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if something such as danger, a feeling etc lurks somewhere, it exists, but you may not see it or know about it
lurk.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a dark formless danger, lurking in the shadows
lurk.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if you lurk in a chat room on the Internet, you read what other people are writing to each other, but you do not write any messages yourself
lurk.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: I think it’s sort of creepy how people lurk in chat rooms.
